intro: Banisteria benghalensis, commonly known as the Bengal banister, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by yellow or orange berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
